content.thinking:
Now I have a clear picture of the project. Let me plan what I need to do:

1. Create a feature branch `feat/landing-page`
2. Create a new landing page at `app/page.tsx` (current home route)
3. Move the quiz to `app/quiz/page.tsx`
4. Create the landing page component
5. Commit and push
6. Open a PR

Let me look at the current `app/page.tsx` and the Quiz component to understand what needs to be moved.

The current structure is:
- `app/page.tsx` → renders `<Quiz />`
- Quiz currently lives at `app/components/Quiz.tsx`


Now I need to restructure this by creating a new quiz route at `app/quiz/page.tsx`, replacing the current home page with a landing page component, and updating any navigation links within the quiz to point to the new `/quiz` path.

content.text: Now I have a clear picture. Let me read the key files before making changes.

content.thinking:
Now I have a complete understanding of the project. Let me plan the implementation:

1. Create a feature branch `feat/landing-page`
2. Create `app/quiz/page.tsx` that renders `<Quiz />`
3. Create `app/components/LandingPage.tsx` - the landing page component
4. Update `app/page.tsx` to render `<LandingPage />` instead of `<Quiz />`

The landing page should:
- Hero section with headline, subheadline, CTA button "Find Your Trainer" → links to /quiz
- "How It Works" section: 3 steps (Take Quiz → Get Matched → Start Training)


- "Why FitMatch" value props section with 3-4 cards, a footer with placeholder links, and mobile-responsive design using the same zinc palette and rounded-2xl styling as the quiz. Let me start by creating the feature branch and then building out these components.

input.content:
import Link from 'next/link'; export default function LandingPage() { return (
{/* Nav */}
FitMatch Find Your Trainer
{/* Hero */}
Toronto Personal Trainers

Find the trainer that's built for{' '} you.

Answer 6 quick questions and we'll match you with Toronto personal trainers who fit your goals, style, and schedule — no guessing.

Find Your Trainer →

Free · Takes 60 seconds

{/* How It Works */}

How It Works

Three steps to your perfect match

{[ { step: '01', title: 'Take the Quiz', body: 'Tell us your fitness goals, preferred training style, and how you like to be coached.', }, { step: '02', title: 'Get Matched', body: 'Our algorithm scores 30 real Toronto trainers against your answers and ranks your top picks.', }, { step: '03', title: 'Start Training', body: 'Browse your matched trainers, visit their profiles, and reach out to begin your journey.', }, ].map(({ step, title, body }) => (
{step}

{title}

{body}

))}
{/* Why FitMatch */}

Why FitMatch

Smarter matching, better results

{[ { icon: '🎯', title: 'Precision Matching', body: 'We score trainers across 5 dimensions — not just location and price — so your match actually fits.', }, { icon: '🏙️', title: 'Toronto-Only', body: 'Every trainer in our database is local to Toronto, with verified specialties and real profiles.', }, { icon: '⚡', title: 'Done in 60 Seconds', body: 'No account needed. No email wall. Just answer 6 questions and see your results instantly.', }, { icon: '🔒', title: 'No Pressure', body: 'We surface the trainers; you decide if and when to reach out. Zero spam, zero obligation.', }, ].map(({ icon, title, body }) => (
{icon}

{title}

{body}

))}
{/* CTA banner */}

Ready to find your trainer?

Join others who found their perfect fitness match in minutes.

Find Your Trainer →
{/* Footer */}
FitMatch
About For Trainers Privacy Terms Contact
© 2026 FitMatch
); }

input.command:
gh pr create --title "feat: add landing page with hero and how-it-works sections" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
- Adds a new landing page at `/` with hero, How It Works, Why FitMatch value props, and footer sections
- Quiz relocated to `/quiz` via a new `app/quiz/page.tsx` page; no quiz logic was changed
- All CTA buttons link to `/quiz` using Next.js `Link`

## Changes
- `app/page.tsx` — updated to render `<LandingPage />` instead of `<Quiz />`
- `app/components/LandingPage.tsx` — new landing page component (hero, 3-step how-it-works, 4 value prop cards, CTA banner, footer)
- `app/quiz/page.tsx` — new route that renders the existing `<Quiz />` component

## Test plan
- [ ] Visit `/` — landing page renders with hero headline, CTA button, How It Works, Why FitMatch, footer
- [ ] Click "Find Your Trainer" CTA — navigates to `/quiz`
- [ ] Visit `/quiz` directly — quiz works as before, unmodified
- [ ] Check mobile layout — all sections stack cleanly on narrow viewports
- [ ] Verify no changes to quiz logic, Results component, or trainers.json

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

content.text:
## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- `app/page.tsx` — swapped `<Quiz />` for `<LandingPage />` so `/` renders the new landing page
- `app/quiz/page.tsx` — new file; thin wrapper that renders `<Quiz />` at the `/quiz` route
- `app/components/LandingPage.tsx` — new component with hero section, How It Works (3 steps), Why FitMatch (4 value prop cards), a dark CTA banner, and a footer; all CTAs link to `/quiz` via Next.js `Link`

## Key Decisions
- Used emoji icons for the value prop cards to avoid adding any icon library dependency
- `LandingPage` is a server component (no `'use client'`) since it has no interactivity — keeps it lean
- Footer links are `<a href="#">` placeholders as specified; no routing needed there

## PR / Branch
- Branch: `feat/landing-page`
- PR: https://github.com/chillkimtest-oss/fitmatch/pull/5

result:
## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- `app/page.tsx` — swapped `<Quiz />` for `<LandingPage />` so `/` renders the new landing page
- `app/quiz/page.tsx` — new file; thin wrapper that renders `<Quiz />` at the `/quiz` route
- `app/components/LandingPage.tsx` — new component with hero section, How It Works (3 steps), Why FitMatch (4 value prop cards), a dark CTA banner, and a footer; all CTAs link to `/quiz` via Next.js `Link`

## Key Decisions
- Used emoji icons for the value prop cards to avoid adding any icon library dependency
- `LandingPage` is a server component (no `'use client'`) since it has no interactivity — keeps it lean
- Footer links are `<a href="#">` placeholders as specified; no routing needed there

## PR / Branch
- Branch: `feat/landing-page`
- PR: https://github.com/chillkimtest-oss/fitmatch/pull/5
